column4: can someone tell me what .m4a format is and what plugin i need to convert it to audio that gnomebaker can burn to cd
its a DRM ridden aac file from the Itunes music store.
there is no way to play it in anything other than itunes.
use itunes to burn them all to a cd, then import the cd, and you'll have usable files.
don't buy drm music in the future if you plan on using linux, it doesn't work out.
i just downloaded it using nicotine off somebody else
so, i can play it on my computer but i just can't burn it to cd? weird...
but that is how it is here
i downloaded the album and can play it but can't burn it
unless you plan on using itunes, there is no easy way of playing it. you have to use ITUNES <--- to burn them to a cd.
i don't know if you are hearing me properly. I am playing the album on ubuntu without a problem, just burning is an issue
you sure? i think m4a stands for mpeg 4 audio and is not itunes
that is why i have no problem playing it. I think the problem is with gnomebaker not being abloeltop burn it
dude, you've gone very quite on me....
i think you were wrong about prempting it to be an itunes drm file
there is no support for that format. it may be an unprotected aac file, so install aac support.
